meanings.sent1: The gymnast was very limber and could touch her toes effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The cat's limber body allowed it to squeeze through the narrow opening.
meanings.sent3: The limber tree branches swayed gracefully in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was as limber as a contortionist, able to adapt to any situation.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's limber movements mesmerized the audience.

meanings.definition: (verb) To make or become flexible or supple
meanings.sent1: She practiced yoga daily to limber up her muscles.
meanings.sent2: The warm-up exercises helped the athletes limber their bodies before the race.
meanings.sent3: The old rusty hinges needed some oil to limber them up.
meanings.sent4: His morning stretches limbered up his stiff joints.
meanings.sent5: The dance instructor encouraged the students to limber up before the performance.
